title: Supersymmetric Noether Currents and Seiberg-Witten Theory
abstract: A reliable method to construct Supersymmetric Noether currents is presented. As the most important application the central charge of the N=2 Supersymmetric Yang-Mills effective theory, known as Seiberg-Witten (SW) theory, is computed. The analisys is carried out in the SW low energy U(1) effective Sector, as well as in the SW high energy SU(2) effective Sector.
